citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of meeting the requirement for regularly scheduled visits to
the premises by the attending veterinarian (AV) in accordance with their Program of Veterinary Care - every 6 months.
The felines had been taken in to the clinic in February of this year, but the AV has not been out to the facility. The formal
arrangement with an attending or consulting veterinarian shall include regularly scheduled visits to the premises, in
addition to the written program of veterinary care.
Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection.

In the goat enclosure, the 4x2 wire had been pushed down by the goats climbing on it and had curled up at the bottom. At
the top, welded wire had been added with exposed sharp points, that protrude several inches, and are sharp, and
exposed. The curled up wire and the sharp points could result in injuries to the goats. The indoor and outdoor housing
facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals. These defects should be repaired in order to protect the animals from potential injury.
Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection.

The water troughs for the goats and the alpacas contained an overgrowth of algae, and therefore were no longer clean
and sanitary. According to the facility, they were cleaned last week. Access to sufficient potable water is required to
maintain the health and well-being of animals. A system of maintenance of the cleanliness of water receptacles and
provision of adequate potable water is required to maintain the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection.

Around the feline enclosures, there was an abundance of flies. While none of the felines were impacted, flies can transmit
disease and can be irritating to the animals. The licensee must establish and maintain an effective method of pest control.
Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 6 August, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

3.130 
   
Watering.

Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection.

3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Around the feline enclosures, there was an abundance of flies. While none of the felines were impacted, flies can transmit

Correct before the next scheduled Re-License inspection. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the

All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 6 August, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
